alert.note: Alert for Knox; Peoria; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 3:20AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and west central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, Peoria and Woodford. In west central Illinois, Knox. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 317 AM CDT, Doppler radar continued to show locally heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Radar estimated that over 2.5 inches has fallen in southeast Knox and northwest Peoria Counties over the last few hours, with up to 2 inches around the north edge of the Peoria metro area eastward into Woodford County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Peoria, Galesburg, Chillicothe, Metamora, Abingdon, Knoxville, Minonk, Roanoke, Princeville, Rome, Dunlap, Washburn, Brimfield, Wataga, Williamsfield, Spring Bay, Bay View Gardens, Rio, Laura and Elmore.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
